Module kivakit.resource
Package com.telenav.kivakit.resource.resources.jar.launcher

Class JarLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
      • com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
        • com.telenav.kivakit.resource.resources.jar.launcher.JarLauncher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, PackagePathed, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver
    public class JarLauncher
extends BaseRepeater
    Launches an executable Java program from some, possibly remote, resource when run() is called.

    Options

    • addJarSource(Resourceful) - Adds a place where a JAR can be accessed, either locally or remotely
    • arguments(String...) - Adds the given arguments to be passed to the new process
    • arguments(StringList) - Adds the given arguments to be passed to the new process
    • enableDebuggerOnPort(int) - Enables Java debugging on the given port
    • headless(boolean) - Launches the process in AWT headless mode, with no tray icon (even temporarily)
    • processType(ProcessType) - Specifies if the process should be a child process or detached
    • redirectTo(RedirectTo) - Specifies how output should be redirected

    Example

    This example launches the executable JAR for PlantUML from a package resource as a child process with the given arguments. It then waits for the process to complete. 

     var process = listenTo(new JarLauncher()
     .processType(CHILD)
     .arguments(arguments))
     .addJarSource(PackageResource.packageResource(getClass(), "plantuml.jar"))
     .redirectTo(CONSOLE)
     .run();

 Processes.waitFor(process);
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
